prompt.content: TASK: Two sets of playing cards will be provided. These sets of cards are the hole and community cards in a no limit texas holdem poker game, respectively. Each card is represented by a value, which can be a number from 2 to 10 or one of the capital letters A, J, Q, K, and a suit, which is one of the lower case letters s, h, c, d. Based on the cards available, return the highest rank of hand that can be formed with these cards. Return only the rank of the hand and no additional information.

data.sampled: A: Two pair (5s,Qd and Kh,Qh) Note: The highest rank in this case is two pair rather than the best possible hand of three of a kind, even though the 10h and Kh can be used to create three of a kind with one of the hole cards. This is because in poker the highest hand possible is used for each category, so two pair is the highest ranked hand that can be formed here, while in other scenarios, such as if the 10h and Kh would be the only available community cards, three of a kind would be the highest hand possible and would be the highest rank.

data.sampled:
A: One pair: J and 10. Both Jc and Js are included. One straight 5s->10s->Jc->Qs->2s. And one three of a kind 5s. In addition there are two pair 10s and Js. Finally, there are three aces, one in the hole, two in the community.

One possible valid outcome is J High straight with three of a kind aces since all hole cards can be ignored. More possible valid outcomes include full house: Js+10s+5s+5d or even a royal flush: Jc+4s+3s+2s+10s all in one suit, although it is highly unlikely.

For highest rank hand only:
One pair: J and 10.
Full house: Js+10s+5s+5d
Three of a kind: 5s.
Ace high: Jd, Jc, 5s+4s+3s, Js.
Straight: Jc+Qs+4d
Flush: Js+Jc+Qs+Qd+5d
Royal flush: Jc+4s+3s+2s+10s.
